stream_context.summary: Stream focuses on live level-building and, chiefly, a deep technical session with micro-code engineer Sauraen to port and benchmark the new F3DEX3 microcode, chasing extra performance for the hack.

development_findings.summary: All interior platforming for the Course 13 ice-castle is complete; remaining work is mainly aesthetic polishing and enemy placement.
A door-based room system is used so geometry behind a closed door is not rendered, aiding performance.
development_findings.quote: By having a door like this, I can make it so that the room behind here doesn't render right now.

development_findings.summary: Transparent rendering order was re-worked: Layer 6 now holds transparent decals rendered before general transparencies (Layer 5) to keep proper Z-ordering.
New mirror section planned where players wall-kick against their mirror image; requires a mirror surface that also acts as a wall.
Fail-safe coin lines and recovery platforms added on the ice slide so most falls are survivable, calibrating difficulty for Course 13.
Outside hub will be a penguin-hut village; Zeina is producing the assets.
development_findings.quote: It will be a little village with penguin huts. Zeina is actually working on some assets for it right now.

development_findings.summary: Game will feature ~12 main levels × 7 stars each (≈84) plus extras, targeting 90–100 total stars.
Demo release is planned "in a few more weeks" after an upcoming video; an editor is already cutting footage.
development_findings.quote: After that, it's going to be the demo. So we have a few more weeks.

development_findings.summary: Sauraen’s F3DEX3 microcode was integrated, giving ~1 ms RDP savings and ~0.3 ms RSP savings on Kaze’s heavy test scene without any visual loss.
development_findings.quote: RDP almost a full millisecond… are you satisfied? –Oh yeah that's much better.

development_findings.summary: Future microcode work: add occlusion-plane version to cut over-drawn triangles and automatic Z-fighting decal fix; will swap microcode per area.
development_findings.quote: I want to get the occlusion plane version available for you so that if you use it… it can help you.

development_findings.summary: Lighting commands must branch between EX2 and EX3 at runtime so emulators still function; Kaze will add self-modifying code later today.
Plan to remove per-limb material duplication on enemies (rabbits) by merging meshes into single-texture materials, reducing draw-calls.
Kaze disabled anti-aliasing via custom GBI define to gain speed; also temporarily no-ops some lighting commands that Fast64 over-writes.

context_findings.summary: Kaze and Zeina recently became parents; baby is staying with grandparents during streams.
context_findings.quote: The baby is currently hanging out with her grandparents.

context_findings.summary: Kaze maintains bodybuilding regimen; plans to start a cutting phase after Christmas for long-term health.
context_findings.quote: I'm kind of just in it for the long term… I usually cut like once a year.

context_findings.summary: Displays playful disdain for Rare’s N64 optimisation, calling Banjo’s runtime decompression "really bad".
context_findings.quote: I'm about to fail a QuickTime event and go on a full rant about how terrible Banjo-Kazooie optimizes.

context_findings.summary: Expresses dislike for traditional JRPG battle pacing despite enjoying Final Fantasy VII’s atmosphere.
context_findings.quote: Goddamn, I hate JRPGs… literally 50 % of the gameplay time is just me sitting there like this.

biobak.summary: Acknowledged missing a week but editing a promotional "video bench" that should be ready soon.
biobak.quote: That's OK, Biobak. I have a video bench for soon anyway. My editor has been on it for a week.

biobak.summary: Provides aesthetic feedback, e.g., praising texture fades and spike charm.

zeina.summary: Creating outdoor penguin-hut assets for the hub area.
zeina.quote: Zeina is actually working on some assets for it right now.

zeina.summary: Enjoying time with the new baby; personal and professional roles overlap smoothly.
zeina.quote: Yeah, Zeina is having a lot of fun with the baby.

key_stories.title: Microcode Overhaul
key_stories.summary: Kaze’s levels started to be RSP-bound, so he invited Sauraen on-stream to integrate the brand-new F3DEX3 microcode. Live benchmarking showed up to 1 ms total frame-time savings.
key_stories.challenge: Heavy scenes were limited by outdated F3DEX2 microcode, making further visual upgrades risky.
key_stories.process: Sauraen explained register allocation and command-dispatch rewrites; Kaze rebuilt the ROM repeatedly, compared counters, and tweaked GBI hints.
key_stories.outcome: EX3 now runs faster than their custom EX2 even with anti-aliasing on; Kaze commits to shipping with EX3 and will add emulator-compat lighting code.
key_stories.key_quote: Oh yeah, that's much better – I'm definitely switching to EX3.

key_stories.title: Designing a Forgiving Ice-Slide
key_stories.summary: Course 13’s slide includes multiple safety nets: coin healing lines and recovery platforms ensure casual players survive most misses.
key_stories.challenge: Balancing difficulty while preventing frustration from long fall deaths.
key_stories.process: Kaze tested falls live, showing where coins or ledges rescue the player.
key_stories.outcome: Deemed "fair" difficulty; slide section considered done.
key_stories.key_quote: First of all, if you fall down here, you can still save yourself like this.
